intro: Gerardia asperula, commonly known as rough gerardia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family, which includes geraniums and other related species. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and serrated, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, clustered flowers are typically pink or purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. Gerardia asperula thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats.
